jam.sort
Class SortRoutine

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jam.sort.SortRoutine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Sorter
public abstract class SortRoutine
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sorter

Abstract class for sort routines which users extend with their own specific code. Defines histograms, gates, scalers, monitors, and parameters. The user writes a sort class which must have the following methods:

initialize
called when the sort process is initialized
sort
called for each event
monitor
called each time the monitors are updated

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ken Swartz

Method Detail

getCamacCommands

public final CamacCommands getCamacCommands()
Returns the object containing commands for the CAMAC controller.

Returns:
commands to be used while taking data from CAMAC bins

getVME_Map

public final VME_Map getVME_Map()
Hands Jam the object representing VME acquisition specifications.

Returns:
the object containing directives for ADC's and TDC's

setEventSize

protected void setEventSize(int eventSize)
                     throws SortException
Explicitly sets the size of a event for offline sorting. Used in the absence of CAMAC or VME specification of parameters. The user has to know what detector each parameter ID represents.

Parameters:
eventSize - number of parameters per event
Throws:
SortException - in case this has been called inappropriately

setEventSizeMode

protected void setEventSizeMode(int mode)
                         throws SortException
Sets how the event size is determined. Generally not called explicitly by subclasses.

Parameters:
mode - how the event size is determined
Throws:
SortException - if called inappropriately
See Also:
SET_EXPLICITLY, SET_BY_CNAF, SET_BY_VME_MAP

getEventSizeMode

public int getEventSizeMode()
Returns the mode by which the event size was set.

Returns:
whether event size was set explicitly, by CAMAC specs, or by VME specs

getEventSize

public int getEventSize()
                 throws SortException
Returns size of a event.

Returns:
the size of the events
Throws:
SortException - when there is no event size yet

setEventOutputStream

public final void setEventOutputStream(EventOutputStream out)
Set the event stream to use to write out events.

Parameters:
out - stream to which presorted event output will go

setWriteEnabled

public final void setWriteEnabled(boolean state)
set the state to write out events

Parameters:
state - true to write out events.

writeEvent

public final void writeEvent(int[] event)
                      throws SortException
Writes an event to the event output stream. Used by the sort() method, if so desired.

Parameters:
event - event to write out
Throws:
SortException - when an unnacceptable error condition occurs during sorting
See Also:
sort(int[])

monitor

public double monitor(java.lang.String name)
Required by the Sorter interface. As written always returns zero, and should be overwritten whenever using monitors.

Specified by:
monitor in interface Sorter
Parameters:
name - name of monitor value to calculate
Returns:
floating point value of the monitor
See Also:
Monitor, Sorter.monitor(String)
